Liquidated(address,bool,uint256,uint256,.details: emitted after a successful liquidation operation

params.bonusInUSD: an amount of bonus (USD) received by the liquidator
params.healing: was the liquidation covering the bad debt (unprofitable liquidation)
params.health: a new health ratio after the liquidation operation
params.initialDebt: sum of all debts before the liquidation
params.initialTotal: total value of assets before the liquidation
params.liquidator: the address that initiated the liquidation operation

LiquidationRepay(address,bytes32,uint256.details: emitted when funds are repaid to the pool during a liquidation

LiquidationTransfer(address,bytes32,uint.details: emitted when funds are sent to liquidator during liquidation

params._liquidationBonusPercent: per mille bonus for liquidator. Must be lower than or equal to  getMaxLiquidationBonus()*
params.amountsToRepay: utin256[] amounts of tokens provided by liquidator for repayment
params.assetsToRepay: bytes32[] names of tokens provided by liquidator for repayment

params._liquidationBonusPercent: per mille bonus for liquidator. Must be lower than or equal to getMaxliquidationBonus()*
params.amountsToRepay: utin256[] amounts of tokens provided by liquidator for repayment
params.assetsToRepay: bytes32[] names of tokens provided by liquidator for repayment

getMaxHealthAfterLiquidation().notice: Returns maximum acceptable health ratio after liquidation*

getMaxLiquidationBonus().notice: Returns maximum acceptable liquidation bonus (bonus is provided by a liquidator)*

liquidateLoan(bytes32[],uint256[],uint25.notice: This function can be accessed by any user when Prime Account is insolvent and liquidate part of the loan with his approved tokens. A liquidator has to approve adequate amount of tokens to repay debts to liquidity pools if there is not enough of them in a SmartLoan. For that he will receive the corresponding amount from SmartLoan with the same USD value + bonus.

unsafeLiquidateLoan(bytes32[],uint256[],.notice: This function can be accessed by any user when Prime Account is insolvent or bankrupt and repay part of the loan with his approved tokens. BE CAREFUL: in contrast to liquidateLoan() method, this one doesn't necessarily return tokens to liquidator, nor give him a bonus. It's purpose is to bring the loan to a solvent position even if it's unprofitable for liquidator.
